summary: The document is a compilation of entries from the Journal - Office of Legislative Counsel on February 11, 1977. It outlines interactions and communications between the Office of Legislative Counsel and various governmental entities and individuals. Key topics include budget discussions for FY78, intelligence-related expenditures, and the handling of classified information by the House Select Committee on Assassinations. Notable mentions include Senators William W. Proxmire and Clifford P. Case's involvement with the Intelligence Subcommittee of the Senate Appropriations Committee and the submission of a foreign service list to the Senate Foreign Relations Committee.
key_findings: Engagements between the Office of Legislative Counsel and the Senate Appropriations Committee staff regarding the FY78 budget and intelligence-related costs.
Senators William W. Proxmire and Clifford P. Case's participation in the Intelligence Subcommittee of the Senate Appropriations Committee.
The process of submitting a foreign service list to the Senate Foreign Relations Committee.
Developments concerning the House Select Committee on Assassinations, including challenges in accessing unclassified materials and the security clearance procedures.
